title: Starting Out with C++: Early Objects 8th c2014 Gaddis txtbk
description:
Starting Out with C++: Early Objects, 8th Edition (c2014), textbook by Tony Gaddis, Judy Walters & Godfrey Muganda.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/product?ISBN=013336092X" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/product?ISBN=013336092X</a>

BRIEF CONTENTS:
--------------
1. Introduction to Computers and Programming
2. Introduction to C++
3. Expressions and Interactivity
4. Making Decisions
5. Looping
6. Functions
7. Introduction to Classes and Objects
8. Arrays
9. Searching, Sorting, and Algorithm Analysis
10. Pointers
11. More About Classes and Object-Oriented Programming
12. More on C-Strings and the string Class
13. Advanced File and I/O Operations
14. Recursion
15. Polymorphism and Virtual Functions
16. Exceptions, Templates, and the Standard Template Library (STL)
17. Linked Lists
18. Stacks and Queues
19. Binary Trees
APPENDICES:
 A: The ASCII Character Set
 B: Operator Precedence and Associativity
 C: Answers to Checkpoints
 D: Answers to Odd-Numbered Review Questions
 *E: A Brief Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming
 *F: Using UML in Class Design
 *G: Multi-Source File Programs
 *H: Multiple and Virtual Inheritance
 *I: Header File and Library Function Reference
 *J: Namespaces
 *K: C++ Casts and Run-Time Type Identification
 *L: Passing Command Line Arguments
 *M: Binary Numbers and Bitwise Operations
 *N: Introduction to Flowcharting
(*Web appendices appended for convenience)

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF.
